mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Morse, L.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Candidate, Capt. Choate, purchased glass and crockery ware in Liverpool and, persuaded by mate Guthrie, smuggled it in instead of paying duty; Guthrie, united with Putnam, commander of the cutter, now threatens prosecution, without proof; Putnam in coalition with Mr. Gibbons; suggests as candidates, Alexander Wyley, son of Col. Wyley, or Benjamin Webley.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1804 January 29, Savannah, [Georgia] to [Thomas] Jefferson, n.p.
